result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CONDITIONS:
COURT MODIFIES ON 2/10/22: CONVERTING THE NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM B TO NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM B ONLY AND THEIR CHILDREN IN COMMON
If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:28 AM    Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dominique T Lindgren in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.
  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Victim B present in the court room in person.

Court to address bail modification: reduction of cash bail and converting no contact with victim B to no violent contact.
Attorney Klein presents arguments to the Court.
Victim B is in agreement to lifting the no contact to no violent contact.
State does not object to lifting the no contact to no violent contact with Victim B only.
States objects to any cash bail modification and presents arguments to the Court.
Court denies the motion to modify the cash bail for reasons set out on the record.
Court grants the motion to lift the no contact with Victim B and their children to no violent contact with Victim B and their children.
